doc.after: The climate of Africa ranges from tropical to subarctic on its highest peaks. Its northern half is primarily desert, or arid, while its central and southern areas contain both savanna plains and very dense jungle (rainforest) regions. In between, there is a convergence, where vegetation patterns such as sahel and steppe dominate. Africa is the hottest continent on earth and 60% of the entire land surface consists of drylands and deserts.[73] The record for the highest-ever recorded temperature, in Libya in 1922 (58Â Â°C (136Â Â°F)), was discredited in 2013.[74][75]
